item.title: Publications
item.description: .card_wrapper { box-shadow: 5px 5px 3px grey; border-width: 1px; border-color: grey; border-style: solid; margin-bottom: 30px; padding: 2%; } .publisher_title { color: #464646; letter-spacing: .2px; font-family: Oxygen,Arial,Helvetica Neue,Helvetica,sans-serif; font-weight: 700; margin: -1% 0% 1% 0%; } .publication_title { margin: 1% 0% 0% 0%; } .publication_authors { margin: 1% 0% 0% 0%; font-style: italic; } .publication_special { margin: 1% 0% 0% 0%; color: red; } .publication_abstract { margin: 1% 0% 0% 0%; } European Journal of Surgical Oncology Predicting response to neoadjuvant therapy using image capture from diagnostic biopsies of oesophageal adenocarcinoma (Nov 2020) Saqib Rahman, Joseph Early, Matt De Vries, Megan Lloyd, Ben Grace, Gopal Ramchurn, Timothy Underwood BASO Raven Prize - Best Presentation Winner The standard of care for locally advanced oesophageal adenocarcinoma is neoadjuvant chemotherapy (NACT) or chemoradiotherapy (NACRT) followed by surgery.

item.title: About
item.description: Joseph is a doctoral student with the University of Southampton and the Alan Turing Institute. He completed an undergraduate degree in computer science at the University of Southampton, and then specialised with a master’s degree focused on machine learning (also at the University of Southampton). Joseph pursed his interest in machine learning and is now researching explainable artificial intelligence – the process of unpacking the “black box” of machine learning and understanding why models exhibit certain behaviours.
